# GCI vs NOGCI
```{r echo=FALSE, results='hide', message=FALSE}
source("functions.R")

gci   = filter(read.al(paste("../experiment/results/",   "listfiller-gci1", ".csv", sep="")), status == 200)
nogci = filter(read.al(paste("../experiment/results/", "listfiller-nogci1", ".csv", sep="")), status == 200)
for (i in 2:10) {
  gci   = rbind(gci, filter(read.al(paste("../experiment/results/",   "listfiller-gci", as.character(i), ".csv", sep="")), status == 200))
  nogci = rbind(nogci, filter(read.al(paste("../experiment/results/", "listfiller-nogci", as.character(i), ".csv", sep="")), status == 200))
}
gci$latency = gci$latency * 1000
nogci$latency = nogci$latency * 1000
```

#### ECDF for response time
```{r  fig.width=15, fig.height=5, echo=FALSE}
graph_tail(gci$latency, nogci$latency, title="THUMBNAILATOR ECDF LATENCY", x_limit_sup=400)
```

#### summary table of confidence interval for response time, both in milliseconds
```{r  fig.width=15, fig.height=5, echo=FALSE}
summary_table(gci$latency, "gci", nogci$latency, "nogci")
```

#### GCI: plot response time
```{r fig.width=10, fig.height=5, echo=FALSE}
plot(gci$latency, ylab="response time", main="GCI")
```

#### NOGCI: plot response time
```{r fig.width=10, fig.height=5, echo=FALSE}
plot(nogci$latency, ylab="response time", main="NOGCI")
```
